data.Name: KANSAS: Point of Know Return Tour
data.Description: With a legendary career spanning more than four decades, KANSAS has firmly established itself as one of Americas iconic of classic rock bands. This garage band from Topeka released their debut album in 1974 after being discovered by Wally Gold, who worked for Don Kirshner, and have gone on to sell more than 30 million albums worldwide. Composing a catalogue that includes fifteen studio albums and five live albums, KANSAS has produced eight gold albums, three sextuple-Platinum albums Leftoverture, Point of Know Return, Best of KANSAS, one platinum live album Two for the Show, and two one million-selling gold singles, Carry On Wayward Son and Dust in the Wind. KANSAS appeared on the Billboard charts for over 200 weeks throughout the 70s and 80s and played to sold-out arenas and stadiums throughout North America, Europe and Japan. Doors at 6:00 PM Event at 7:30 PM

data.Name: Celtic Women: Postcards from Ireland
data.Description: Celtic Woman Live at the Historic Avalon Theatre! In the fourteen years since its 2005 debut, global musical sensation Celtic Woman has emerged as a genuine artistic phenomenon representing Irish music and culture all over the world. The groups concert tours continue to touch the hearts of a devoted audience that spans the globe. Both an accomplished recording ensemble and a world-class performing collective, Celtic Woman celebrates Ireland's rich musical and cultural heritage, while continuing its remarkable legacy of introducing some of Ireland's most talented singers and musicians onto the world stage. Doors at 6:30 PM Event at 7:30 PM

data.Name: Don Mclean: 50th Anniversary Of American Pie
ARTURO SANDOVAL 10 Time Grammy Award Winner
data.Description: Singer & Simpson Productions Proudly Present ARTURO SANDOVAL 10 Time Grammy Winner! Cuban-American trumpeter Arturo Sandoval, one of the most dynamic and vivacious entertainers of our time, and a protégé of the legendary jazz trumpeter Dizzy Gillespie, is a brilliant, multifaceted and renowned musician. Arturo Sandoval has won 10 Grammy Awards and was awarded The Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2013. He received an Emmy Award for his composing work on the underscore of the HBO movie based on his life, For Love or Country starring Andy Garcia as Arturo. He has performed at The Whitehouse and at the Super Bowl with Tony Bennett and Patti LaBelle. Mr Sandoval has recorded 32 albums as a leader, and 36 more in collaboration with other prominent artists. He is a composer, arranger and conductor with multiple film credits, a ballet score, and performances with symphonies here and in Europe. He is a six time Billboard Award winner and received the 2015 Hispanic Heritage Award.
